title: Geri Horner 'almost booted out of Spice Girls for being tone-deaf’
text:
Geri’s time in the Spice Girls reportedly almost never was

Geri Horner could easily have been an unfamiliar name if the original Spice Girls boss had his way, as it’s claimed he tried to get the popstar booted out of the girl group.

A new unauthorised biography from Sean Smith, titled The Story of the World’s Greatest Girl Band, claims how Bob Herbert – who managed the group’s first management company – didn’t have confidence in Geri’s vocal ability.

According to Smith, Bob wrote a memo detailing his plans to remove Geri from the line-up and even reportedly had a replacement waiting in the wings.

In an excerpt serialised in The Sun, Bob’s scathing memo allegedly states: ‘We included Geri because she had a very strong personality and her looks seemed to suit the image we were trying to project.

‘Unfortunately she was tone deaf and had awful timing, which meant she was unable to sing in tune or dance in time…’

It continued: ‘For weeks her lack of talent was a severe problem for her but with perseverance we found slots for her in the harmonies and the dance routines.’

The girl group, also consisting of Mel B, Emma Bunton, Victoria Beckham and Mel C, hit the ground running with their debut in 1995.

Geri’s vocal technique reportedly needed work at the beginning of her career (Picture: Getty Images)

Geri’s big personality in the Spice Girls is legendary (Picture: Redferns)

Of course, Geri’s larger-than-life personality was a big part of the band’s eventual success with stunts like pinching Prince Charles’ bum or wearing that minuscule Union Jack dress to the Brit Awards in 1996.

Smith writes how Geri, 47, stormed the offices of Heart Management in a bold attempt to get signed to the group without auditioning.

Chris reportedly recalled: ‘It didn’t dawn on me at the time but I think she obviously knew she would have failed an early round audition and she wanted to bypass that.’

The Spice Girls reunited this year for an epic tour (Picture: PA)

Geri knew her earlier talents needed honing and is once said to have admitted: ‘I didn’t think I would have got an audition. My vocal technique was not very good.’

Bob died in August 1999 at the age of 57 in a car accident.

The Spice Girls reunited this year to perform a set of successful – and lucrative – in stadiums around the UK this summer, including a three-night stint at London’s Wembley Stadium.

However, it was recently reported the group have cancelled their planned Australia tour due to tensions between Geri and Mel B.

Metro.co.uk has contacted Geri and the Spice Girls reps for comment.
